name: Chickpeas With Baby Spinach
description: This is mostly a pantry dish, very quick to put together. You can serve it on its own, with couscous or pasta, or over a thick slice of toasted bread rubbed with garlic.
keywords: chickpea, spinach, dairy-free, gluten-free, halal, healthy, high fiber, kosher, low cholesterol, nut-free, vegan, vegetarian, main course
recipeIngredient: 1 teaspoon cumin seeds, lightly toasted and ground
Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
1 cup chicken or vegetable stock, or water

recipeInstructions.text: Heat the olive oil in a large, heavy saucepan over medium heat and add the onion. Cook, stirring, until tender, about five minutes. Add the garlic, cumin, tomato paste and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Cook, stirring for one to two minutes, until fragrant and the tomato paste has turned a darker color. Add the chickpeas, the stock or water, and the cayenne, and bring to a simmer. Cover, reduce the heat, and simmer 10 minutes.

Stir in the spinach, a handful at a time, stirring until each addition of spinach wilts. Add salt to taste and simmer uncovered, stirring often, for five minutes. Add lots of freshly ground pepper, taste and adjust salt and cayenne, and serve.
